messageBody:
Why do you want to use the standard features of JUnit (the Assert class)
when testing a non-standard feature (overwriting the equals method)?
The simpliest solution is to write your own Assert class:

public class BaseBusinessObjectAssert {

public static void assertEquals(String message,
BaseBusinessObject expected,
BaseBusinessObject actual) {
if (! test_without_the_equal_method) {
Assert.fails(message);
}
}

}

and your test class will look like:

public class SimpleTest extends TestCase {
public void testBlah() {
BaseBusinessOBjectAssert.assertEquals(..., ..., ...);
}
}

You can write a class to test Arrays, Comparable objects, Gauss numbers, ...

Hope it helps

-Vladimir
